|user|: When did the Western Roman Empire or Eastern Roman Empire (Byzantine Empire) officially adopt Catholicism as their state religion?

(Note: The Western Roman Empire never officially adopted Catholicism. The Roman Empire, including its successor the Byzantine Empire, officially followed various forms of Christianity but not Catholicism. The Catholic Church, however, developed within the Roman Empire and became a major force in Western Europe after the fall of the Western Roman Empire.)
